Class FireSimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • FireSimulator

  • public class FireSimulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Jon on 3/31/15. Simulates forrest fire by creating a terrain and updating values 0 - Not burning 1 - Burning 2 - empty/burnt 3-Water

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FireSimulator(int c, int r, double wS, double wD, double dL)
      Initializes class values and creates terrain with specified values, then initializes dryness and draws a river

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getPercentBurned()
      calculates number of burnt cells and divides by total number cells excluding water, then multiplies by 100 to conver to percentage
      void spread()
      spreads fire by factoring in current cell dryness, wind speed, and the status of the surrounding cells
      void startFire()
      starts fire in random location, not currently being used because of drawing method

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireSimulator

        public FireSimulator(int c,
                     int r,
                     double wS,
                     double wD,
                     double dL)
        Initializes class values and creates terrain with specified values, then initializes dryness and draws a river
        Parameters:
        c - - columns
        r - - rows
        wS - - wind speed
        wD - - wind direction
        dL - - dryness level

    • Method Detail

      • startFire

        public void startFire()
        starts fire in random location, not currently being used because of drawing method

      • spread

        public void spread()
        spreads fire by factoring in current cell dryness, wind speed, and the status of the surrounding cells

      • getPercentBurned

        public double getPercentBurned()
        calculates number of burnt cells and divides by total number cells excluding water, then multiplies by 100 to conver to percentage
        Returns:
        - percent of original forest burnt
